fields.description:
h3. Summary
Korean characters aren't formatted correctly when adding new components to Jira: e.g "준" (jun) is written as "ㅈㅜㄴ"

h3. What we expect:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. What we experience:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. How to replicate
# https://<cloud_name>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project_key>/administer-components
# Click Add Components ( !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! )

h3. Workaround
None at this time, we'll add a workaround if it exists.
fields.summary: Korean characters not formed correctly when adding Components (e.g "준" is written as "ㅈㅜㄴ")

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, to change the outgoing email address, a Jira admin needs to update the address per project bases as described in [[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-email-notifications-776636790.html]]. 

So, the Jira admin has to update the outgoing email address each time a new project is created. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a feature on the SMTP mail configuration page accessible through */secure/admin/OutgoingMailServers.jspa* to apply the outgoing email address change for all current and newly created projects. 

h3. Why this is important
* More efficient. 
* Less time consuming. 
 
h3. Workaround 
For now the change is only made per project basis.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin I want to change the outgoing email address through the SMTP mail configuration page

fields.description:
Make the toolbar scroll with you as you scroll down a long ticket description. In the old view, this was all in the small textbox (with a scrollbar) so the toolbar for formatting was always within reach. In the new view descriptions can get very long (which I like!) but the toolbar stays at the top. On our very long issues, this makes it nearly impossible to use the visual editor.

Old View:

!oldview.gif|width=325,height=221!

New View:

!newview.gif|width=334,height=253!
fields.summary: New issue view -- scrolling toolbar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, all users across all groups can use the mobile client.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have the option for the group to disable mobile clients. For example, all users within that specific group cannot use the mobile app.
fields.summary: Disable Jira on Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a Checkboxes field, with many options (enough to need to scroll), then the options on the bottom will typically be cut off from the page if the page is not pre-scrolled to accommodate the pop-up. This is particularly problematic if the user does not have a scroll wheel on their mouse as they must drop the focus on the field in order to scroll the page.


h3. Environment
New Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a "CheckBoxes" field and fill it with lots of options. Around 15 or so should work.
# Open an issue in the board view (the pop-up modal) as this is a smaller screen and more likely to cause the issue.
# Scroll such that you can see the list but leave it such that it is closer to the bottom of the screen when you click it.

h3. Expected Results

The System detects that some options will not fit in the view and either resize the menu such that it fits on the screen or scrolls the page to improve the focus on the menu. 

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown menu only shows partially as it is cut off from the rest of the screen.
 

h3. Workaround
- If you have a scroll wheel or equivalent, you can scroll the page manually to fit.
- you can pre-scroll to ensure the most space for the popup.

You may need to ensure that the field layout places the checkboxes fields closer to the top to ensure that space is more likely to be available.
fields.summary: Setting a Checkboxes field with many options in the new issue view cuts off some options if scrolled too far up

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

When you're seeing the issues using the *List View*, it's possible to add the *Status Category Changed* information, however, when you export the issues, this data is not exported.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

The *Status Category Changed* should be exported to the external file as the other information in the List View.

h3. *Why this is important*

Once this information is displayed in the List View, it should also be exported.
fields.summary: Export the Status Category Changed information to external files.
Opening direct link to non-existing project and issue will give Internal server error instead project not found or issue does not exist

fields.description:
h2. Problem

The *jira.permission.scheduleissue.group* restricts the due date field to be changed only for certain group set on the *Property key*. Usage:
* _Property key_: {{jira.permission.scheduleissue.group}}
* _Property Value_: {{some_group}}

Currently, it will only take effect if added in statuses. The field will be affected in the current status and all the transitions that go out of that status as well.

But, in some cases, there may be different transitions coming out of the status, but you do not want to restrict the due date on both of them, or at least the same way.

h2. Suggestion

Have that property work when applied to a transition, so it is possible to restrict only at the project level.
fields.summary: Ability to use the property jira.permission.scheduleissue in transitions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, Jira resizes issue type icons (including custom ones) to 16x16.

In 4k resolutions, for example, the icons will get blurry:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-28 at 8.50.35 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Change the icons' resolution.

A better resolution, that would be well handled even in 4k resolutions would be 32x32.
fields.summary: Change the default size for issue types' icons

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Selecting columns in Issue navigator and selecting "Done" does not apply the columns to the search filter (Intermittently).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Issue navigator > List view
# Edit the columns and select columns
# Press "Done" 

h3. Expected Results
Search filter should immediately show the newly selected columns.


h3. Actual Results
Newly selected columns do not appear on the search filter.


h3.Workaround
Refresh the page. The select columns will appear. 

h3. Notes
After the first page refresh the issue does not happen again. Any newly selected columns appear when saved as expected.
fields.summary: Selecting columns in Issue navigator and selecting "Done" does not apply the columns to the search filter.

fields.description: Support grouping things by theme / product area e.g. grouping things under multiple "header" rows, or lanes.
fields.summary: Next-gen project's Roadmap feature is awesome and need to add support for grouping.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new issue view takes the space encoding of "*%20*" and converts it into "*%2520*" in the URL which potentials leads you to a 404 page depending on the URL.

Looks like Jira is reading the encode input as "*%20*" for *space* and "*%*" for "*%25*".

 !HTML_URL_Encoding_Reference.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In the old view, add a URL link with the space encoding (ie: https://www.google.com/search?q=hello%20world#brs)
# Switch to the new view and click or hover on the URL link.

h3. Expected Results

The link is saved with the same URL provided and when clicking on it, directs you to a new page with the same URL (https://www.google.com/search?q=hello%20world#brs).

h3. Actual Results

The URL gets converted into https://www.google.com/search?q=hello%2520world#brs and potential breaks the page.

 !_KFF-4__Test_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

This behaviour is seen in most text-based fields such as *Comments* and *Description*.

h3.Workaround

If already saved, you can edit the link on the new view and add the URL, then save which fixes it, otherwise, the URL should always be added in the new view.

 !_KFF-4__Test_-_Jira_corrected.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New view incorrectly converts space HTML encoding in URL link

fields.description:
While doing a Basic Search for Status in Jira, the Dropdown only shows the Status alphabetically upto letter "O". !Screen Shot 2019-06-12 at 3.50.49 PM.png!

 

 All other statuses are not visible and there is no scroll bar in the popup. on the other hand, when starting to type, suddenly the invisible status appears in the list.
fields.summary: Jira Basic search options are limted

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your locale to English
# In a project that is linked with Bitbucket, include an issue to a version
# In Bitbucket side, perform smart commit referring the issue key by merging w/o PR
# In Jira side, navigate to "Releases" > the version you used at 1
# The number of issues is shown with no wrapping
 !スクリーンショット 2019-06-12 9.40.53.png|thumbnail! 
# Change your locale to Japanese

h3. Expected Results
The number of issues is shown with no wrapping

h3. Actual Results
The number of issues is shown with word wrap by each character, which affects the readibility
 !スクリーンショット 2019-06-12 9.41.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No
fields.summary: When using Japanese, the column width is not adjusted in the Release page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the filter results gadget (and potentially other gadgets) to trigger the "Log Work" action will cause the log work page to be brought up with the following query parameter: returnUrl=undefined

This causes the user to be redirected to an undefined page when they submit the time update.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# ensure that you have a saved filter and a filter results gadget to use for testing
# using the filter result, hover over an issue in the results, and click the "..." drop down to select "log work"
# You will be redirected to a new page to log work. You can either log work or cancel logging work to trigger the effect.

h3. Expected Results

The user would be redirected back to the previous page.

h3. Actual Results
Query parameter is set to "returnUrl=undefined" so the user is redirected to "/secure/undefined" which gives a 404 error.
 

h3. Workaround
there is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Logging work from a Gadget such as the filter results gadget provides undefined redirect back

fields.description: In old issue view, if we hover pointer to user it gives us the email ID and user details. In new issue view, we are not seeing this functionality. Please add this functionality as it is useful to see user details if needed.
fields.summary: Hovering mouse pointer to user does not show details of user in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The customer wants to introduce a feature to find and replace in the Description field

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers should be able to to find and replace in the Description field

h3. Why this is important
Customers willing to find and replace in the Description field should have the functionality
fields.summary: Introduce a feature to find and replace in the Description field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it's not possible to find out which issues were created by a mail handler.
In Jira Service Desk, we have the feature *channel* that allows us to do this, but we still don't have it in Jira Core/JSW.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Enable the *Channel* feature across all JIRA platforms or create a different solution that allows us to gather this information.

h3. Workaround
Use an add-on such as *Enterprise Mail Handler for Jira* to alter the description of the issues created by the mail handler upon creation. This way, the user can perform a JQL and find the issues. Yet, this will only collect issues that were created by the mail handler after the add-on was installed and this was set up.
fields.summary: Ability to find out which issues were created through a mail handler
JSON import does not accept Email address for reporters or assignee

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a site logo at Jira Server
# Create a backup file of issues and Jira application home directory, using the steps described at https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/migrate-from-jira-server-to-jira-cloud-972349848.html
# Import each files using the steps described at step 4 and 5

h3. Expected Results
The site logo will be updated using the data stored in the `logos` folder

h3. Actual Results
The site logo remains the same
 
h3. Notes
This was reproduced using Jira Software 7.13.3

h3.Workaround
At Jira Cloud site, set the site logo again by accessing to Jira settings > Look and Feel
fields.summary: Site logo not imported upon migration from Server to Cloud

fields.description:
I want to be able to view issue lists and work with issues viewing them as a table (as possible in advanced search). To me there's no reason to have different viewing options between advanced search and the issue listing, it just adds confusion since many us switch between issue listing (My open issues, all issues, etc) and advanced search. 

The best option would be to have the same user interface and options (as advanced search) and also the ability to use advanced search in the issue listing would be great instead of having to click and reload the page.
fields.summary: The same UI options in issue list as in advanced search

fields.description:
Issue:

Currently there is no export function of filtered queue under Service Desk. This is very inconvenient to the user. It is time-wasting for users to cpoy and paste manually one by one.
fields.summary: [Export Function] CSV Format of Filtered Queue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Filter Subscriptions will still send emails to users that have been deactivated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test filter
# Create a new user that you can access the instance as.
# ensure the user has the permissions required to access the test filter
# log in as the user and subscribe to the filter. Set the time to every 15 minutes to make it trigger rapidly, and set it to send even if the filter results are empty. This will help work around permissions issues in trying to reproduce the issue.
# deactivate the user by using the "revoke site access" option from the "..." menu in the user search
# Wait for the next filter subscription trigger. You may need to wait for a couple of cycles, so do something else and then check the inbox later. The emails should be there.

h3. Expected Results

No email would be sent.

h3. Actual Results

Emails are sent.


h3. Workaround:

Currently, the only way to solve this issue is to reactivate the user, log in as the user in question, then browse to the filter and remove the subscription. You can then deactivate the user again and the emails will no longer be sent.
fields.summary: Deactivated users still receive emails from filter subscriptions

fields.description: When having the "Allow all statuses to transition to this on", it should be possible to order the status in a particular order and not to have it alphabetically ordered.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the possibility to order the status in a particular order when all status have the "Allow all statuses to transition to this on" configuration

fields.description:
h2. (!) *This is an intermittent issue* (!)
h3. Summary

When clicking on the three dots icon in a gadget and then on the "Assign to me" button, Jira will throw a 404 error page.

h3. Environment

Dashboard and filter results gadget.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Access a dashboard with the filter results gadget;
# Click on the three dots icon and "Assign to me".

h3. Expected results

The ticket is assigned to the user that performed the action.

h3. Actual result

Jira throws a 404 error page (URL: <domain>.atlassian.net/secure/undefined), but the ticket is assigned correctly.
GIF: https://cl.ly/29378db2caf7
fields.summary: Selecting "Assign to me" from a dropdown in a gadget throws a 404 error

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

The users created a Project and added a custom field called "Enquiry Closed" which is date & time picker field type, however, users are unable to edit the exact time? It only provides the users with a list  to choose from i.e. 1:00 pm or 1:30 pm but if the users need to input 1:34 pm they can't. 

h3. *Expected*
 * All user able to edit the specific time i.e. 1:34 pm
 * !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Actual Result*
 * The user  is only able to edit the custom field in 30 minutes interval
 * !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Workaround*
 * The user should switch back to the old view.
* *Profile Avatar > Personal Settings* Under Jira Labs toggle the New Issue View to “OFF”
fields.summary: Unable to edit the date time range picker to specific time on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When uploading an image/file with a colon (: ) in the filename in issue comments, an error message *We couldn't save your comments* is shown.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in Jira
# Try to upload an attachment with a filename having a colon (: ) to the comments section
# An error message is shown
 

h3. Expected Results
Able to upload image with a colon in the file name

h3. Actual Results
  !error message.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot upload file with colon(:) in the file name to issue comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When moving the issues in an Epic and then canceling it shows 404 error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to an Epic with connected Issues ("Issues in this Epic")
2. Move one of the connected Issues
3. After the move or if you cancel the move -> 404

h3. Expected Results
The user should be returned to the Epic 

h3. Actual Results
 [^move error.mov] 

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: When moving the issues in an Epic and then cancelling it shows 404 error

fields.description:
When an issue is mentioned in Jira, the description of the issue is added to the mention. In cases where the description of the mentioned issue is long, this makes issue mentions unpleasant as the issue mention itself becomes long.

The description does give users a convenient way to understand the context of an issue mentioned.

Suggestion: I suggest showing the description when the issue mention is hovered over.
fields.summary: Remove description from issue mentions

fields.description: While this page on triggers applies to all Jira products, triggers are designed to work closely with development tools, and are most powerful when used with Jira Software.
fields.summary: Add a "Pull request approved" to workflow triggers

fields.description:
With the changes in the new issue view, the edit screen is no longer going to be a separate entity from the view screen. As a result the filter results gadget (which only displays in list mode) no longer has the "edit" option in the drop down ellipsis menu.

I would like to propose that the gadget at least get the option to open the new issue view modal (like in the board view) when one wants to edit issues.
fields.summary: Add back edit or equivilent to the ellipsis menu for the filter results gadget.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Links name to Confluence pages created by former users are not displayed, instead, a warning is displayed:

(!)
 _We couldn't load this page. {color:#0747a6}Open in Confluence{color}_
h3. Environment

New Jira issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * 1. Go to a software project;
 * 2. Open the new Jira issue view;
 * 3. Try to link a Confluence page created by a Former user
 * 4. Notice the page title it is not displayed

h3. Expected Results

The page title is successfully displayed
h3. Action Results

There is a warning mentioning that the page couldn't be loaded.

Workaround

If we click on the link, this will successfully redirect to the proper page.
fields.summary: We couldn't load this page. Open in Confluence in the New Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When pasting a link from Google drive a preview is supposed to show up asking to provide Atlassian app the permission to access the data on Google drive Doc: 
*  !002.PNG|thumbnail! 

When the permission is granted, the preview is supposed to show the link name and don't ask anymore for the permission. 
*  !004.PNG|thumbnail! 

However, after further tests, it was identified that links pasted from Google Drive works as expected but links pasted from *Google Team Drive shares* are *NOT*. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a shareable Google Team Drive link 
#*   !005.PNG|thumbnail! 
# Paste it in a comment in a Jira issue
# The following message will show up: 
#*  !002.PNG|thumbnail! 
# You click on the link and you provide the necessary permission.   
#*  !006.PNG|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
* The permission is granted and the file name shows up: 
**  !004.PNG|thumbnail!  

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens for links from Google Team Drive shares. However it works as expected for links from Google Drive. 
*  !001.PNG|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
* None for now.
fields.summary: As a Jira user when I paste a Google Drive link I'm continuously asked to provide "permissions to view" and nothing happens

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* In some resolutions *only on modal* the warning pop up on Labels field is cutting off if the user tries to add a label with space or any incorrect character.
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-07 at 11.25.09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Cloud;

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Go to *active sprints* > *click in any issues* > Try to *add a label with space or any incorrect character*


h3. Expected Results
* Warning pop up on Labels field will appear properly
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-07 at 11.25.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* Warning pop up on Labels field will cut off
fields.summary: Warning pop up on Labels field is cutting off

fields.description:
There is already a Javascript and Python client for working with ADF https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/apis/document/libs/ but many vendors use Java to implement their apps.

More context on wiki added as an internal note
fields.summary: Java client for building/parsing ADF

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When email notifications are triggered using the new batched email notifications the quote and new issue view code block formats are formatted incorrectly in the body of the email resulting in the code block having a defined block region per line and the quote having every word split into a seperate line.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and edit the description to include a code block in the new issue view or the quote tags in the old issue view. 
{noformat}
{quote} 
TEST TEST TEST 
TEST TEST 
TEST TEST TEST
{quote}
{noformat}
# Change between these formatting options to trigger email notifications

h3. Expected Results
The email notification should highlight the change of formatting and displayed as in the body of the issue description. 
*New Issue View Code Block*
 !codeblock.png|thumbnail! 
*Quote*
 !quote.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The email places each line of the code block in it's own block container and each word of the quoted text on a seperate line.
 !batchedemail.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New batched email notifications are not handling the quote or new issue view code block formatting correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When logging into _id.atlassian.com_ with Safari, after several redirects user is shown "atlassian.io" page with an error message "*Safari can't open the page* because Safari can't establish a secure connection to the server "atlassian.io".
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Try to access id.atlassian.com
h3. Expected Results

User logins successfully
h3. Actual Results

Error message is shown "Safari can't open the page"
h3. Workaround

Even after Safari shows an error, user is logged in. Try to access Jira / Confluence or any other Atlassian Product using direct URL and it will be working just fine.
fields.summary: Login to id.atlassian.com via Safari doesn't work

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to hide or collapse some columns on Business Boards to make cards better to read or just hide the columns that I'm not using at the moment, so I can have more space only for the columns that I need.
fields.summary: Hide or collapse Columns on Business Boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user that does not have access to the instance tries to access a direct link to a board, it throws a 500 error
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to access an instance you do not have access to e.g. [https://XXXXXX.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&selectedIssue=ABC-1|https://xxxxxx.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&selectedIssue=ABC-1]

h3. Expected Results

Jira redirects to the login page or informs that the email address does not have an account on the instance
h3. Actual Results

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 * Go directly to [https://XXXXXX.atlassian.net/|https://xxxxxx.atlassian.net/]
fields.summary: Jira Is Throwing 500 Error When The User Does Not Have Access

fields.description:
h3.Summary

This is very similar to JRACLOUD-71354 .  The only difference is that this bug happens when you attempt to move all issues in the project via bulk operations (instead of moving one issue at a time manually) from the issue navigator.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

# Create an epic with multiple child tickets.
# Navigate to issue navigator.
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
# Attempt to use bulk operations to move issues.
# Error is returned.
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
The issue is moved together with its sub-tasks

h3. Actual Results
An error message is thrown:
{noformat}At least one of the issues you are trying to move has been recently updated by another user (NG-7). Please cancel and start again.{noformat}

h3. Workaround
One workaround would be to create a task in the destination project and move only the sub-tasks. However, this is not practical for situations when the user needs to move multiple tasks together with their sub-tasks
fields.summary: Using bulk operations to move parent tasks (with sub-tasks) from next gen to classic project returns error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Cloud by Atlassian application doesn't Notify users of their own changes.

h3. Steps to replicate the issue
Make sure to set *Notify users of their own changes* to *Yes* under *Default user preference*.

On the Jira Cloud for Atlassian Mobile App,
* Assign an issue to a user
* We do get a notification on Email.
* But no push notification on the Mobile device

* Ask a colleague to perform the same change on the issue.
* We do receive a notification both on Mobile as well as Email.

The Mobile app does not honor the Default user preference set in Jira

h3. Other Troubleshooting
* All the Notification setting s ate enabled in Jira application
* The Jira Notification is enabled on the Device application settings as well.
* Affects both iOS and Android devices


h3. Workaround
No workaround so far
fields.summary: Jira Cloud by Atlassian Mobile application doesnot Notify users of their own changes

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update - 6 October 2021}
Hi everyone,

There’s been a delay with being able to reference existing attachments in the issue view. This feature is still a top priority for us and we will continue work on this project as a top priority. For now you can still  [temporarily click through to the old view|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/temporarily-click-through-to-the-old-issue-view/] to reference attachments in the old view. 

Kind regards,

Atlassian
----
*Atlassian update - 18 March 2021*
Hi everyone,

Work on attachment referencing in the new issue view has begun! When this feature is released, you’ll be able to reference existing attachments in comments and fields using the editor. This ticket is a top priority we’re currently working on and will be done after we transition everyone to the new issue view.

Make sure to watch this issue for updates on our progress.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}
h3. Summary

When clicking on the files & images button of edit comments in the new issue view it takes you to the upload images instead of browsing the attachments of the issue

Steps to Reproduce
 # Click to add a comment on a ticket (on the new issue view)
 # Click on add images icon

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to browse the attachments of the issues
h3. Actual Results

The upload images screen appears
h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround

However, as mentioned in the personal settings page, please note that:
{quote}The new issue view is on for all [business|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORECLOUD/See+what%27s+possible+with+Jira+Core] boards and [next-gen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-next-gen-software-projects-945104895.html] projects, so this won't affect them.
{quote}
fields.summary: When adding a comment and using the files & images icon doesn't browse the attachments of the issue

fields.description:
h3. Description:
Jira creates tokens that are used for searching purposes. This way, whenever searching for key words, Jira is able to retrieve the desired results.

Tokens are created after the comment's content. When mentioning a user in the old issue view, Jira is able to create tokens for the user identifier. In the new issue view, however, this does not work as expected.

Below, an example of how this works in the old issue view:
* Example of comment {quote}
\[~<username>\] test 
{quote}

Resulting tokens:
* {quote}
'<username>' 'test'
{quote}

However, when the same comment is added in the *new* issue view, Jira creates the following tokens:
* {quote}
'test' 'unknown'
{quote}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a comment mentioning your own user using the new issue view
 # Run the following JQL search to retrieve issues with comments where your user was mentioned
* {{comment ~ currentUser()}}

We created a video reproducing this problem: [^comment.mp4]
h3. Expected results:
 * JQL search will return all issues where the user was mentioned

h3. Actual results:
* Jira will not retrieve issues with mentions that were created using the new issue view
* Jira will still retrieve issues with mentions that were created using the *old* issue view 

h3. Workaround
* Create comment using the old issue view.
fields.summary: Mentions on the new issue view are not being correctly tokenized

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the old view, there was an option called *Configure fields*, where you could select which fields would be displayed for you in the edit screen:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-05 at 14.26.25.png|thumbnail! 

That was useful in cases where there are different teams that work in the very same issue, but those teams do not really have the interest in the same information (different fields within the issue).

That would remove the need to go trough unnecessary information, specially when editing issues in the board.

h3. Suggested solution

Add the ability to configure fields. For example, when opening an issue in its detail view in a board:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-05 at 14.32.01.png|thumbnail! 

Obs: currently, that option will take you to the issue layout section.
fields.summary: Ability to choose which fields will be displayed individually in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *People* custom field for Team-managed (Next-gen) Project isn't captured correctly by Jira. The field isn't sorted correctly in the Issue Navigator nor can it be used in the Two Dimensional Filter gadget. This is applicable for most gadgets that uses a custom field (eg. Pie Chart)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a Next-gen Project, add the *People* custom field to an Issue type
# As it is a user picker field, add users to this field for several Jira Issues
# In the Issue Navigator, order results by this field in any order
# Add a Two Dimensional gadget to a Dashboard, using that field for the Axis (ie: Yaxis = *status*, Xaxis = *people*)

h3. Expected Results

In the Issue Navigator, the results are expected to be sorted by this field and the Two Dimensional gadget is expected to display the different values for this field on an Axis.

h3. Actual Results

The results are not sorted in the Issue Navigator.

 !_Filter_for_NG__Issue_navigator_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

The values are not recognised in the Two Dimensional gadget on a Dashboard.

 !Shared_Dashboard_test_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

This seems to be applicable for all gadgets.

 !agdgets.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround found at this moment.
fields.summary: People custom field from Team-managed projects do not work with gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Description
All unauthenticated users now receive a 500 internal server error message when trying to access a project page directly via a URL

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Log off or make sure that you don't have a valid account
# Get a link to a board or project and try to access it

h3. Expected results
Jira should prompt to perform a login

h3. Actual results
Error 500 of internal server error is returned.

h3. Workaround
# Log out of your account by clicking https://id.atlassian.com/logout
# Access https://id.atlassian.com and log back in using your credentials
# Try accessing the page again
fields.summary: All unauthenticated users now receive a 500 internal server error message when trying to access a project page directly via a URL

fields.description:
Create a standard Dashboard Gadget that displays text entered into the gadget.

Could be used to display Team Announcements, important updates, etc.
fields.summary: Create Dashboard Gadget to display Text

fields.description: Create a standard Dashboard Gadget that displays Sprint Goals for the current/Open Sprint.
fields.summary: Dashboard Gadget to display Sprint Goals

fields.description:
h2. Description
Having issues' summary with a carriage return at the end of the text will result in an incorrect .csv formatting.

h2. Steps to reproduce
* Create an issue with a carriage return at the end;
* Filter some issues to export. Make sure to include the issue with the summary with a carriage return at the end;
* Export these issues to a .csv file;

h2. Expected results
The file will be formatted correctly.

h2. Actual results
The file will be incorrectly formatted.

Example below:
Issue example:
 !issue_example.png|thumbnail! 

.csv file:
{code}
Issue Type,Issue key,Issue id,Assignee,Reporter,Priority,Status,Resolution,Due date,Summary
Story,PS-240,10788,,admin,Medium,To Do,,,"Story 1
"
Story,PS-239,10787,,admin,Medium,To Do,,,Story 2
Story,PS-235,10779,,,,To Do,,,"Story 3
"
{code}
fields.summary: Exporting a .csv file containing issues summary's with a carriage return at the end of the line results in an incorrectly formatted file

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The customer wants to dynamically sync issues to a spreadsheet

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers should be able to dynamically sync issues to a spreadsheet

h3. Why this is important
Customers having issues want the data to be pulled dynamically into a spreadsheet
fields.summary: Ability to dynamically sync Jira issues to a speadsheet

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When configuring a *Default Configuration Scheme* for a Custom field to have a default value, that default value is still being added to the associated Issue type even though the field is not included in the Screen layout.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a Custom field to have a default value (ie : Single text field)
# Make sure that the Custom field is not included in any Screens associated with the Issue type
!Configure_Screen_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
!Configure_Custom_Field__TEXT_FIELD__SINGLE__-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Because the field is not included in the Screen, no value should be associated with the field as it is not in use.

h3. Actual Results

Behind the scenes, that default value is added to the Issue and can be seen in the Issue Navigator.

 !Issue_navigator_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

This is applicable for all Custom field types.

h3.Workaround

As a workaround, you can adjust the Applicable contexts for the scheme so that the default value is only applicable to specific Issue types.
 !Modify_configuration_scheme_context_-_JIRA_type.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Default value still being added to fields when not included in Screen layout
Couldn't parse JSON data for invisible character in the issue's summary

fields.description:
h2. Detail
----
When a specific item type is transitioned to a specific status, it would be incredibly useful for our company workflow to automatically assign an item to specific people (or a person with a specific role). 

 
h2. User Flow Example
---- # User is on the Project Board
 # User moves an item of type "Bug" from the status "Open" into the status "Fixed"
 # Item that was moved is automatically assigned to user with the role "QA Lead"

In a similar example, an item with the type "Task" that is moved to the status of "Fixed" may be assigned to a user with the role "Director".
fields.summary: Next-gen - Add rule option to assign to a user when transitioning based on Item type

fields.description:
h3. Description
Whenever a comment is added with a user mention, two events are expected to be triggered:
- comment
- commentMention

Previously, in both the *old and new* issue views, whenever a user was mentioned on a comment these two events were fired by Jira. This seems to have started to happen when the old issue view started to handle mentions as *\[Full Name|~accountid:<id>\]* instead of referencing the email address.

Currently, however, the "commentMention" event is *not* being fired upon a mention in the *old issue view*, causing email notifications to *not be sent* unless the user is configured as a recipient of the *Issue Commented* event.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Switch back to the *old issue view*
# Create a comment with a mention, as exemplified below
*  !Screen Shot 2019-06-04 at 11.15.19 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results:
Events are triggered by Jira and mention notification is sent.

h3. Actual results:
Only the *comment* event is triggered. In case the user who's being mention is not configured to receive this type of message in the *Notification scheme*, he *will not be* notified of this event.

h3. Workaround:
This problem *does not occur* when using the new issue view. Also, this does not occur if the user mentioned is set as a recipient of *Issue Commented* events in the *Notification Scheme*

h5. Notes:
This impacts scenarios where notification schemes are configured so that users only receive notifications of comments where they are *mentioned*.
fields.summary: Mention does not trigger "commentMention" event in Old Issue View

fields.description:
With a physical scrum board and sticky notes it is so easy to see where issues are clumping up on the board. With Jira this is hard.

 

I suggest that you add a view that fits the whole board in one screen. The ticket cards could be made smaller and could fit beside each other in the columns, instead of the current view that shows issues stacked in a column one ticket wide.

 

The tickets would not have to display as much information as they do in the current board view. This would also be similar to a physical board, if tickets are clumping up on a physical, then they overlap and you can not tell at a glance the details of all the tickets, just that there is a clump.
fields.summary: Add a view that fits the whole scrum board in one screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new Jira UI: 
* When clicking on "Advanced search" on the issues pages the contextual sidebar is replaced with the global sidebar. 
* This causes the loss of all the project context and user needs to navigate through all projects again or the browser's back button

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a project 
# make some modifications into the project (such as updating an issue)
# Verify that the sidebar is the contextual sidebar
# Go to "Advanced search"
# Verify that the sidebar changes to the "global sidebar"

h3. Suggested Results
* Sidebar remains as "contextual sidebar"

h3. Actual Results
* Sidebar changes
fields.summary: Contextual sidebar replaced by global sidebar on advanced search page (New UI)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Error type: 500 - Internal server error being thrown for Jira

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Able to access Jira dashboard

h3. Actual Results
Error type 500 is displayed

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira error: Error type: 500 - Internal server error

fields.description: Currently, when users receive emails with notifications grouped together, comments on tickets are placed below updates in the emails. It would be great if we could add any way to either not group updates and comments together or put comments at the top.
fields.summary: Email notifications ordering

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In a Service Desk project, if an approver views the ticket internally (from within Jira, not through the Service Desk Portal) and the issue has multiple available transitions from the status which requires approval, the "Approve" and "Decline" button will be separated by the "Edit" button.

 !Approve.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Change this behaviour to keep both buttons together at all times.

h3. Why this is important
This should improve the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
The New Jira Issue View should be available to Service Desk projects shortly. This fact will probably address this issue.
fields.summary: I'd like the "Approve" and "Decline" buttons to stick together when viewing a ticket from within a SD project

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently only four *Quick-add buttons* are visible in [Jira new issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/work-in-the-new-issue-view-962349095.html], additional buttons or options will be listed in a dropdown menu as per screenshot below:
 !New issue view - Quick-add buttons.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement the ability to configure this feature which allows admins to customise the order of the buttons or the number of visible buttons.
fields.summary: Ability to configure quick-add buttons in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the new issue view, adding a bullet list on a formatted word (bold or italics) does not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Edit a text field, eg issue description or comment.
- Enter a sentence containing some text without any styling.
- Click on a word in the sentence and then click Bullet List – the sentenced is bulleted as expected.
- Un-bullet the sentence, select any word in the sentence and click Italic – the word is italicised as expected.
- Click in the italicised word and then click Bullet List – the sentenced is not bulleted.
- If you click on another word in the sentence, bulleting seems to work.
- The same problem occurs with Numbered List.
- The same problem occurs in you bold the word rather than italicise it.

h3. Expected Results
The sentence should form a list

h3. Actual Results
 [^text bullet.mov] 

h3. Workaround

Use the old view.
fields.summary: When using the new issue view, adding a bullet list on a formatted word (bold or italics) does not work

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The modified date for every JIRA backup generated on Cloud is showing wrong date/time values currently.

 !image (5).png|thumbnail! 

 Seems to be due to the achieving application that ZIPs the backup during backup creation.

h3.Workaround

No workaround for this.
fields.summary: Modified date values are off for all backups generated on Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users with no *Edit issues* (This is specific to the assignee field at the people section on the right panel) permission unable to re-assign issues despite having the *Assign* *issues* permission
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User with *Assign issues* and no *Edit issues* permission:
 Can assign issue to anyone with *Assignable issues* permission
 Cannot re-assign issue (can only set to unassigned or assign to me)
 # User with *Assign Issues* and *Edit issues* permission:
 Can assign issue
 Can re-assign issue

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to re-assign issues

*Actual Results*
 User is unable to re-assign issues unless given the Edit issues permission

*Workaround*
 None
h4.
fields.summary: Users with no 'Edit issues' permission unable to reassign issues despite having 'Assign issues' permission

Update:
It seems that the service is now restored. If you have any problems with Google related services please raise a new support request at https://support.atlassian.com

Could we please get an option to see the actual markup/text in the new ticket description editor when re-editing? Sometimes I would like to copy/paste some details into a different ticket without losing the original markup. Copy/pasting from WYSIWYG doesn't work well. 

Just like this editor have a "Visual" and "Text" tab.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description
Increase the limit (32767) of allowed characters for description and comment in new issue view.


h3. How to  replicate the issue
Open an issue
update description with more than 32767 characters.
We get an error: the Entered text is too long. Exceeds 32767 characters

fields.description: Currently, on the column config, users will only be able to set the WIP limit. There is no functionality to see the accumulated story points for the entire column.
fields.summary: Include accumulated story points

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a quick search, when searched for a number and click on view all issues don't show appropriate results

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few Jira issues with a number (for example, 1000) in the *Summary* field
# In the quick search, type the number 1000 and a few results are shown.
# Now click on *View all issues* and it opens a new window with issue key 1000 appended to a random project.

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on *View all issues* should show all the issues having the search term.

h3. Actual Results
View all issues do not show appropriate results

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to add *_* before or after the number so that search returns all the issues having search term.
fields.summary: Quick search do not work properly when searching with numbers

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 November 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
This ticket is tracking two seperate issues which have duplicate tickets.
 # Missing keyboard shortcuts in the new issue view. See: JRACLOUD-69301
 # Missing fully-functional dot "." menu. See: JRACLOUD-71827

In order to make sure that we are able to accurately communicate the progress we are going to close this ticket in place of the two issue linked above. Please follow each of these tickets, if you are not already.
{panel}
h3. Issue description
A few Keyboard Shortcuts like *e*,*l*, *Shift-CTRL-B* and also the *(.)* search for issue fields do not work as expected in Jira new issue view.
Other shortcuts like *a* work well.
It affects only the new issue view. In the old issue view, the keyboard shortcuts work well.

h3. Steps to replicate the issue
Open an issue
Press *e* to edit issue
Press *l* to update the labels

h3. Expected Behavior
To be able to edit issue

h3. Current Behavior
The keyboard shortcut doesn't function at all
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcuts like e, l, Shift-CTRL-B and also the (.) search for issue fields do not work as expected in Jira new issue view

fields.description:

Users who use Firefox to load Project pages in Jira is facing slowness as compared to using Google Chrome.

Access the Project pages using Firefox. 

h3. Expected Results
- The project page loads similar to the load time in Chrome.

h3. Actual Results
- On the project page, there is around a second or two before the links becomes clickable

h3. Workaround

Use Google Chrome
fields.summary: Loading Project pages in Firefox is slower compared to Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When updating the parent of an issue in a Next-gen project, the activity stream gadget will display a new entry, but it cannot get the name of the field. Instead, it is displaying *issue.field.issueparentassociation*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-30 at 14.15.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access an issue in a Next-gen project -> click on the ellipses button -> *Add to parent issue*:
 !modify parent.png|thumbnail! 
* Check the entry in the activity stream gadget.

h3. Expected Results

Checking the modified issue's history, the entry displays the field's name as *Parent*:
 !parent.png|thumbnail! 

So, the gadget should display that as well.

h3. Actual Results

The field is described as *issue.field.issueparentassociation*.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Activity stream cannot display Parent field's name from Next-gen projects

To include the account id along with the name & email address for each user in the User management section.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In old issue view, when user activated Comments editor, then decide to edit Description field, when they click on Preview button to preview it, then click on it again, it commits the Description and move the cursor to Comments editor. This video demonstrates it, [^preview-description.webm]

h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Comment button to activate the editor
 # Click on Description field to edit it
 # Enter some text in Description field and click on Preview button
 # Click on Preview button once again to get back to Description field editor

h3. Expected Results

Description field editor is activated.

h3. Actual Results

Comment editor is activated.

h3. Workaround

No workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Custom field creation freezes when 'Previous' is clicked to switch to a different type

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 [^Field freeze ..mov] 

h3. Expected Results
The second field should get created after clicking on previous.

h3. Actual Results
The second field does not get created after clicking on previous.

h3.Workaround
No Workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a backup for Jira server, users are presented with the option to delete all next-gen projects because they're incompatible with Server sites. When a user acknowledges by clicking delete all, a 404 error is returned

h3. Environment
Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 next gen projects
# Go to Global Settings -> System -> Backup manager
# Look for Server back up
# Both next-gen will be listed with the option to delete all next-gen projects
# Click delete all next-gen projects

h3. Expected Results
All next-gen projects are delete

h3. Actual Results
404 error returned

h3. Workaround
delete the projects one by one from the backup manager
fields.summary: Delete all next-gen projects while creating server backup not working (returns 404)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Once a [Next-Gen|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Agility-articles/Classic-and-featured-project-templates-in-Jira-Software-Cloud/ba-p/862404] project is created in the cloud site and if more than one new scoped custom field is created with a similar name to the global custom field it becomes confusing to JQL query an Advanced Search.


h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Next-Gen project
# As a Jira admin, check the list of custom fields in your site through /secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
# Let's get for example the custom field that I have on my test instance named *Business Line*:
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to the newly created Next-Gen project and created a custom field with the same name
#*  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
#* Don't forget to save!!
#  Again, this time, create a new Next-Gen project
# Again, create another custom field with the same name in this newly created project
# Now, go to make an Advanced Search
# It is extremely hard to differentiate between these fields: 
#*  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
#* An end user is not supposed to know the id of each custom field.    
#* Imagine for someone who has 35 Next-Gen projects for example on his site.
#* Imagine for someone trying to choose between two custom fields that are both related to Next-Gen project

h3. Expected Results
* It easy to identify which value to choose from during making the *"Advanced Search"*

h3. Actual Results
* if there were only two values we can identify that the first value is related to a global custom field and the second one is related to a scoped custom field. However, It is confusing to find more than two values with the same name.

h3. Workaround?
* A workaround would be to verify the id 
* Or, choose a different name
fields.summary: As a Jira user It is extremely confusing to JQL query an Advanced Search if more than one Next-Gen project is created on my site

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
 * The custom field of type (Message Custom Field (for view) *is not* respecting the order according to the issue layout configuration.

h3. *Expected*
 * If you create a custom field of type *(Message Custom Field (for view)* and set this field as secondary if the field has no value the field must be under show more because it's empty.

h3. *Actual Result*
 # If you delete the value of the field, (If the field was created with a value), the field will be above the show more (even configured as secondary) the field will be showing as a primary field.
 # If you create the field with *no value* and set the field as secondary in the issue layout, the filed will not show up (like the field were hidden or just disappear).

h3. *Workaround*
 * There is no workaround for that.
fields.summary: Custom field of type (Message Custom Field (for view) is not respecting the issue layout configuration

fields.description: We want to use the Business Project template for project management, however it seems you can't connect a Confluence Space using the Pages feature under "Add Item". This seems like a no-brainer to me. Documentation in project management is a core feature.
fields.summary: Add Pages feature to JIRA for Business Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69400].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Several past cases have been reported of Jira admins trying to use a user custom field value or a group custom field value to set a project permissions such as 'Create Issue' or 'Browse Project'. The intention of the admin here is to only allow the possible users in that custom field options to have that specific permission. This does not work though for these specific permissions, because in order to evaluate these permissions the issue has to already be created in Jira. These custom fields would have to have a value set within them on an issue already created. The potential values of that field are not valid as a means to impose a permission grant on those specific permission options. In the case of creating issues, it can't possibly work because the issue is not created yet.
h3. Suggested Solution

Change the way permission schemes work and edit the screens there in to prevent admins trying to set permissions that can never possibly be valid within Jira. This could be done by specifically removing 'user custom field value' and 'group custom field value' from the objects that cannot possibly honor their hypothetical values yet. We know this includes at least create issue and browse project, but there could be others in play here as well.
h3. Why this is important

Lots of admins in Jira have attempted to configure this because Jira allows it, But can't possibly honor it. It causes high levels of frustration and angry users to have Jira let you do something that it has no expectation of being able to do.
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26659
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30783
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-66317
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21613
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30783
 [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/JIRA-Bug-with-Group-Custom-Field-Permission-Settings/qaq-p/734856]
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Jira Permission schemes should not allow you to attempt to configure nonsensical permission states

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Global transition name doesn't display in new issue view. It displays correctly in old issue view. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a workflow
# Create a global transition
# Then, open a new ticket or existing ticket.

h3. Expected Results
The global transition name display. From the old issue view , display as below (Pending (2)) :-
 !Screenshot 2019-05-29 at 3.15.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
*Transition to* text displayed. As per screenshot below (when have multiple global transition) :-
 !Screenshot 2019-05-29 at 3.14.36 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-common_transitions

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Global transition name didn't display in new issue view

fields.description: Ability for an Option to merge cells of table in Jira Issue description.
fields.summary: Want to merge cells of table in JIRA  Description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing the initial Sprint suggestions from the Sprint field. Current Active Sprint may not be suggested. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Expose the Sprint field via screens
 # Create a sprint and start it
 # Create 10 or more future sprints
 # Open any issue in the backlog or outside of the board, click on the Sprint field and inspect the suggestions.  

h3. Expected Results

The *Active Sprint* should be suggested.

h3. Actual Results

The *Active Sprint* will be empty. Only the last 10 created future sprints will be suggested. 

 !sprint suggestion.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes

If you add a new sprint in *another board*. The last 10 sprints suggested will be extracted from that board. This is regardless if the issue is related to that board or not. 

h3. Workaround

a.) Sprints are global in nature. When the Sprint field is updated directly in the issue, there is a chance that the incorrect Sprint from another board is assigned. It is best to use the drag and drop option within the backlog page of the board to avoid incorrectly assigning an issue to a sprint from another board. 

b.) Type in the name of the Sprint in the Sprint field to return more suggestions. 

c.) Disable the new issue view. To accomplish this, please perform the steps below:

# Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)
fields.summary: Initial sprint suggestion does not show Active sprints correctly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Changes made in jira.table.cols.subtasks has no effect in the Old Issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Navigate to https://<Cloud URL>/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa
# Make changes to jira.table.cols.subtasks by adding more fields

h3. Actual Results

The Subtask doesn't show the added fields.

h3. Expected Results

The Subtask should shown the added fields configured in Advanced Settings.

h3. Notes

The columns (list of sub-tasks) sequence are not being followed.

h3. Workaround
No workarounds
fields.summary: Updating jira.table.cols.subtasks in Advanced Settings has no effect on the Old Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the New Jira Issue View, if the project has multiple issue types from the sub-task category and they have a field required in the create screen, Jira will override the sub-task type that the user selected and will default to the previously created sub-task issue type (as seen in the following video):

 [^JRACLOUD-72144.mp4] 

h3. Suggested Solution
Jira should stick with the sub-task issue type that the user has selected.

h3. Why this is important
This should improve the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
At this moment, users must change the issue type again in the create screen.
fields.summary: When creating an inline sub-task that has a field required, I'd like the sub-task type to stick in the create screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description
Strike-through wiki-markup does not work if strike-through text ends with a URL
Affects new issue view

h3. Steps to replicate
In the new issue view, add a URL as a comment
Select the URL and StrikeThrough
Observed that the URL is not Striked
 !Screenshot 2019-05-27 at 8.08.37 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Strike-through wiki-markup does not work if strike-through text ends with a URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing any bulk operation that has issues from a Next-Gen project the process fails and returns a page with error 500 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Next-Gen project
# Create issues
# Try to perform any bulk operation from issue navigator

h3. Expected Results
The process should end as expected

h3. Actual Results
The process fails and an error 500 is returned

h3. Workaround
In the next-gen project, create the sub-task issue type. This will eliminate the 500.
The sub-tasks types will need to be created in both the source and destination projects.
This workaround only works in some instances.
fields.summary: Bulk operation in Next-Gen issues returns error 500

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the rules that govern if a in app bell notification is created is the same notification scheme used to govern email notifications. 

If an admin wanted to turn off all email notifications yet only have in app ones this is currently not possible. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a separate notification scheme configuration for in-app notifications or the option to apply the current schemes to email, in-app or both. 

h3. Workaround
Disable outgoing mail, however this is not ideal as this is stie wide and not on a per-project basis.
fields.summary: Include notification scheme customization options for bell notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we have set a large count to say 50 in Wallboard slideshow configuration, a single screen is displayed with some 17 issues (depending on zoom percentage) only with no possible way to scroll the screen up or down and no transition happening.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a gadget to the dashboard
 # Set to visualize in the Wallboard slideshow with count 50.
 # Only 18 issues are displayed and there is no way to slide the screen up and down and no way for the transition. A single screen with many issues missing at the bottom can be seen. Now if we reduce the count to let us say 15, we can see the page numbers appearing at bottom and we need to manually click at each to browse through issues.

h3. Expected Results

It should display all the issues or some way to browse through all the issues and not just a single screen when the result count is high in number. 

Actual Results

Currently, it simply projects the screen on the display. It displays a limited number of issues.
h3. Workaround

There is a workaround. We can reduce the *Number of Results* in wallboard display configuration count and we can see multiple pages which cover all the issues.
fields.summary: Wallboard Slideshow is not respecting the Number of Results and transitions doesn't work when issue count displayed is high

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 24 October 2019}
The "create sub-tasks" buttons are now available in the new issue view for Jira Service Desk projects.
{panel}

h2. Problem Definition
The new issue view in Jira Software includes the a button to create a sub-task and the old issue view for Jira Service Desk includes the Create sub-task option in the ellipses menu.

Neither of these are available in the new issue view in Jira Service Desk.

Current Jira Software (new issue view):
 !Screenshot 2019-05-24 at 09.30.04.png|thumbnail! 

Current Jira Service Desk (old issue view):
 !Screenshot 2019-05-24 at 09.30.27.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Suggested Solution
Include the create sub-task button in the Jira Service Desk new issue view.

h2. Workaround
Switch to the old issue view to access the Create sub-task option in the ellipses menu
fields.summary: Add "create sub-task" button on Jira Service Desk New Issue View

fields.description:
Problem Definition
It's not possible to search for parent issues where its sub-tasks have specific criteria.

Suggested Solution
Create a JQL function to check for child issues summary, description, status, etc.

Why this is important
Sometimes it's necessary to search for issues where its sub-tasks meets certain conditions, and this is not possible at the moment. 

Workaround
N/AS
fields.summary: JQL to search for issues where its sub-tasks meets certain conditions

fields.description:
When I create a filter, the results are dynamic depending on the filter setting. So each time I run a filter the results may be different. There are very few "useful" filters that are capable of displaying a static set of issues.

What I would find extremely useful would be the ability to capture the results of a given filter in a static list. I would expect the this to be possible by capturing the issuekey for each item that exists in the current results and generating a new filter based exclusively on issuekey. Users would be given the option to name this query when it is created.

I am aware that I can filter by issuekey in the advanced filter settings. But creating a query based on issuekey manually is not feasible because I may be looking at hundreds of issues I am trying to capture in a query that would deliver the same results every time I run it.

Ideally, this could be a button that appears in line with the filter settings. "Capture Results" would be an ideal name for this button.
fields.summary: Feature - "Capture Filter Results as a List" to target a specific batch of bugs in a static list.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When sharing a filter (not a ticket) in Jira, the email header will contain the following Return-Path:
{code}
Return-Path: <bounces+something@201701confluence.atlassian.net>
{code}

The Return Path's domain is {{201701confluence.atlassian.net}} and this is what SPF uses to check. That domain is not the same used in other basic notifications in Jira, which is {{mail-us.atlassian.net}}.

The domain {{201701confluence.atlassian.net}} is not configured to accept some of the IPs used by Jira Cloud, so it gets a HARD FAIL for SPF and those messages may be rejected, depending on email server configuration.


h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Go to issues and filters > Click to share any filter
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-24 at 16.48.27.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The email will be sent and the domain in 'Return Path' will be the same as in other notification messages.


h3. Actual Results
The email is being sent but with '201701confluence.atlassian.net' domain as Return Path and may be blocked.


h3.Workaround
* For now, we don't have yet a workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Notifications from filter shares may be blocked due to SPF fail

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The *jira.permission.assignable.projectrole* restricts the assignees to users associated to project roles.

Currently, it will only take effect if added in statuses. The issue view will be affected in the current status, and all the transitions that go out of that status as well.

But, in some cases, there may be different transitions coming out of the status, but you do not want to restrict the assignee on both of them, or at least the same way.

h3. Suggestion

Have that property work when applied to a transition, so it is possible to restrict only at project level.
fields.summary: Ability to use the property jira.permission.assignable.projectrole in transitions

fields.description:
The search for inactive users has been deprecated from the [Find users API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-user-search-get] ( /rest/api/3/user/search ). This feature request is to provide a new endpoint or an automated way to retrieve the inactive users' information.

Currently, it's required to manually generate a CSV of the users to have this information.
fields.summary: Provide an API to search inactive users

fields.description: Make possible to create a rule on Next-Gen Board that allows to increment a Number Field.
fields.summary: Increment Number Field Next-Gen Board

fields.description:
When searching for a dashboard or a filter, Jira will try to match each word in the search box and return multiple results. 

 !dashboard search.png|thumbnail! 

To search for an exact match, the group of words needs to be enclosed in double quotes. 

 !double.png|thumbnail! 

The usability of the search box is not very intuitive when searching for a group of words. 

*Suggestion*

When searching for a group of words, there should be no need to enclose in double quotes. Return the exact matches at the top of the list and then the rest of the fuzzy search results
fields.summary: Improve searching for dashboards and filter names
